GrowthSpan: Rapid growth, especially in bright, indirect light.
Benefits: Spider plant is effective in cleaning indoor air by absorbing chemicals including formaldehyde, xylene, benzene, and carbon monoxide in homes or offices.
Care: Water when the top inch of soil is dry. Can tolerate occasional neglect. Prefers well-draining soil and moderate humidity.

LightRequirement: Low to medium, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight as it can scorch the leaves.
LifeSpan: Typically 3-5 years, but can live longer with proper care.
Benefits: Excellent air purifier, removes toxins like benzene, formaldehyde, and trichloroethylene.
Care: Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Prefers high humidity and well-draining soil. Fertilize monthly during the growing season.

Temperature: Prefers temperatures between 55-80°F (13-27°C). Can tolerate higher temperatures if kept dry.
LifeSpan: Can live up to 12 years or more with proper care.
Benefits: Medicinal properties, used for skin care and minor burns.
Care: Water deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. Requires well-draining soil and low humidity.

LightRequirement: Low to bright, indirect light. Can tolerate low light conditions.
LifeSpan: Can live for decades with proper care.
Benefits: Air purifier, removes toxins like formaldehyde, xylene, and toluene.
Care: Allow the soil to dry out between waterings. Prefers well-draining soil and can tolerate low humidity.

Temperature: Bright, direct sunlight for at least 6 hours a day.
LifeSpan: Typically 2-3 years as a perennial, but often grown as an annual.
Benefits: Bright, colorful flowers; improves air quality.
Care: Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Water at the base to avoid wetting the foliage.

LightRequirement: bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light.
Temperature: 65-80°F (18-27°C). Protect from drafts and extreme cold.
Benefits: Effective at removing indoor air pollutants like formaldehyde, benzene, and trichloroethylene. Adds tropical aesthetic appeal.
Care: Keep the soil evenly moist but not soggy. Reduce watering in winter.

LightRequirement: bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light conditions.
Temperature: 50-70°F (10-21°C). Can tolerate cooler temperatures but is sensitive to frost.
Benefits: Excellent air purifier, removing mold spores and common indoor toxins. Adds greenery to indoor spaces.
Care: Keep the soil evenly moist, but avoid waterlogging. Reduce watering in winter.

LightRequirement: bright, indirect light but can tolerate some direct morning sunlight.
Temperature: 60-75°F (15-24°C). Sensitive to cold drafts and frost.
Benefits: Excellent air purifier, removing toxins like formaldehyde and xylene. Adds lush greenery and enhances humidity in indoor spaces.
Care: Keep the soil consistently moist, but not soggy. Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.

LifeSpan: 10 years or more with proper care
Benefits: Air purification, humidifies the air
Care: keep soil moist but not soggy, avoid direct sunlight, fertilize during growing season

LightRequirement: Bright, indirect light to low light
Benefits: Air purification, good for low-light areas
Care: Keep soil evenly moist, avoid overwatering, fertilize in spring and summer

LifeSpan: 10 years or more with proper care
Benefits: Air purification, decorative foliage
Care: Allow soil to dry out between waterings, tolerate low light, wipe leaves to remove dust

Benefits: Air purification, pet-friendly
Care: Water regularly, keep soil slightly moist, avoid direct sunlight

Benefits: Aromatic, used in aromatherapy, culinary uses, repels insects
Care: Well-drained soil, water deeply but infrequently, prune annually

Benefits: Fragrant flowers, used in perfumes and teas
Care: Regular watering, well-drained soil, support for climbing varieties

Benefits: Culinary uses, medicinal properties, repels insects
Care: Moist soil, frequent watering, container planting recommended to control spread

Benefits: Culinary uses, aromatic, medicinal properties
Care: Well-drained soil, water deeply but infrequently, protect from frost

Temperature: Prefers warm climates, but varies by species
Benefits: Aromatic oils, medicinal properties, insect repellent
Care: Well-drained soil, drought-tolerant once established, regular pruning

LifeSpan: Perennial in warm climates, annual in colder climates
Benefits: Ornamental, aromatic leaves, some varieties have culinary uses
Care: Well-drained soil, regular watering, deadhead to promote blooming

Benefits: Aromatic, culinary uses, medicinal properties, attracts pollinators
Care: Moist, well-drained soil, regular watering, can be invasive

Benefits: Aromatic, culinary uses, medicinal properties
Care: Well-drained soil, water regularly but allow soil to dry between waterings, prune to maintain shape
